content: 1 Paul, a called apostle of Jesus Christ, by God’s will, and Sosthenes the brother,
content_old: 1 Paul, a called apostle of Jesus Christ, by God’s will, and Sosthenes the brother,

content: 2 to the assembly of God which is in Corinth, to those sanctified in Christ Jesus, called saints, with all that in every place call on the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, both theirs and ours:
content_old: 2 to the assembly of God which is in Corinth, to those sanctified in Christ Jesus, called saints, with all that in every place call on the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, both theirs and ours:

content: 3 Grace to you and peace from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ.
content_old: 3 Grace to you and peace from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ.

content: 4 I thank my God always about you, in respect of the grace of God given to you in Christ Jesus;
content_old: 4 I thank my God always about you, in respect of the grace of God given to you in Christ Jesus;

content: 5 that in everything ye have been enriched in him, in all word of doctrine, and all knowledge,
content_old: 5 that in everything ye have been enriched in him, in all word of doctrine, and all knowledge,

content: 6 (according as the testimony of the Christ has been confirmed in you,)
content_old: 6 (according as the testimony of the Christ has been confirmed in you,)

content: 7 so that ye come short in no gift, awaiting the revelation of our Lord Jesus Christ;
content_old: 7 so that ye come short in no gift, awaiting the revelation of our Lord Jesus Christ;

content: 8 who shall also confirm you to the end, unimpeachable in the day of our Lord Jesus Christ.
content_old: 8 who shall also confirm you to the end, unimpeachable in the day of our Lord Jesus Christ.

content: 9 God is faithful, by whom ye have been called into the fellowship of his Son Jesus Christ our Lord.
content_old: 9 God is faithful, by whom ye have been called into the fellowship of his Son Jesus Christ our Lord.

content: 10 Now I exhort you, brethren, by the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that ye all say the same thing, and that there be not among you divisions; but that ye be perfectly united in the same mind and in the same opinion.
content_old: 10 Now I exhort you, brethren, by the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that ye all say the same thing, and that there be not among you divisions; but that ye be perfectly united in the same mind and in the same opinion.

content: 11 For it has been shewn to me concerning you, my brethren, by those of the house of Chloe, that there are strifes among you.
content_old: 11 For it has been shewn to me concerning you, my brethren, by those of the house of Chloe, that there are strifes among you.

content: 12 But I speak of this, that each of you says, I am of Paul, and I of Apollos, and I of Cephas, and I of Christ.
content_old: 12 But I speak of this, that each of you says, I am of Paul, and I of Apollos, and I of Cephas, and I of Christ.

content: 13 Is the Christ divided? has Paul been crucified for you? or have ye been baptised unto the name of Paul?
content_old: 13 Is the Christ divided? has Paul been crucified for you? or have ye been baptised unto the name of Paul?

content: 14 I thank God that I have baptised none of you, unless Crispus and Gaius,
content_old: 14 I thank God that I have baptised none of you, unless Crispus and Gaius,

content: 15 that no one may say that I have baptised unto my own name.
content_old: 15 that no one may say that I have baptised unto my own name.

content: 16 Yes, I baptised also the house of Stephanas; for the rest I know not if I have baptised any other.
content_old: 16 Yes, I baptised also the house of Stephanas; for the rest I know not if I have baptised any other.

content: 17 For Christ has not sent me to baptise, but to preach glad tidings; not in wisdom of word, that the cross of the Christ may not be made vain.
content_old: 17 For Christ has not sent me to baptise, but to preach glad tidings; not in wisdom of word, that the cross of the Christ may not be made vain.

content: 18 For the word of the cross is to them that perish foolishness, but to us that are saved it is God’s power.
content_old: 18 For the word of the cross is to them that perish foolishness, but to us that are saved it is God’s power.

content: 19 For it is written, I will destroy the wisdom of the wise, and set aside the understanding of the understanding ones.
content_old: 19 For it is written, I will destroy the wisdom of the wise, and set aside the understanding of the understanding ones.

content: 20 Where is the wise? where scribe? where disputer of this world? has not God made foolish the wisdom of the world?
content_old: 20 Where is the wise? where scribe? where disputer of this world? has not God made foolish the wisdom of the world?

content: 21 For since, in the wisdom of God, the world by wisdom has not known God, God has been pleased by the foolishness of the preaching to save those that believe.
content_old: 21 For since, in the wisdom of God, the world by wisdom has not known God, God has been pleased by the foolishness of the preaching to save those that believe.

content: 22 Since Jews indeed ask for signs, and Greeks seek wisdom;
content_old: 22 Since Jews indeed ask for signs, and Greeks seek wisdom;

content: 23 but we preach Christ crucified, to Jews an offence, and to nations foolishness;
content_old: 23 but we preach Christ crucified, to Jews an offence, and to nations foolishness;

content: 24 but to those that are called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ God’s power and God’s wisdom.
content_old: 24 but to those that are called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ God’s power and God’s wisdom.

content: 25 Because the foolishness of God is wiser than men, and the weakness of God is stronger than men.
content_old: 25 Because the foolishness of God is wiser than men, and the weakness of God is stronger than men.

content: 26 For consider your calling, brethren, that there are not many wise according to flesh, not many powerful, not many high-born.
content_old: 26 For consider your calling, brethren, that there are not many wise according to flesh, not many powerful, not many high-born.

content: 27 But God has chosen the foolish things of the world, that he may put to shame the wise; and God has chosen the weak things of the world, that he may put to shame the strong things;
content_old: 27 But God has chosen the foolish things of the world, that he may put to shame the wise; and God has chosen the weak things of the world, that he may put to shame the strong things;

content: 28 and the ignoble things of the world, and the despised, has God chosen, and things that are not, that he may annul the things that are;
content_old: 28 and the ignoble things of the world, and the despised, has God chosen, and things that are not, that he may annul the things that are;

content: 29 so that no flesh should boast before God.
content_old: 29 so that no flesh should boast before God.

content: 30 But of him are ye in Christ Jesus, who has been made to us wisdom from God, and righteousness, and holiness, and redemption;
content_old: 30 But of him are ye in Christ Jesus, who has been made to us wisdom from God, and righteousness, and holiness, and redemption;

content: 1 And I, when I came to you, brethren, came not in excellency of word, or wisdom, announcing to you the testimony of God.
content_old: 1 And I, when I came to you, brethren, came not in excellency of word, or wisdom, announcing to you the testimony of God.

content: 2 For I did not judge it well to know anything among you save Jesus Christ, and him crucified.
content_old: 2 For I did not judge it well to know anything among you save Jesus Christ, and him crucified.

content: 3 And I was with you in weakness and in fear and in much trembling;
content_old: 3 And I was with you in weakness and in fear and in much trembling;

content: 4 and my word and my preaching, not in persuasive words of wisdom, but in demonstration of the Spirit and of power;
content_old: 4 and my word and my preaching, not in persuasive words of wisdom, but in demonstration of the Spirit and of power;

content: 5 that your faith might not stand in men’s wisdom, but in God’s power.
content_old: 5 that your faith might not stand in men’s wisdom, but in God’s power.

content: 6 But we speak wisdom among the perfect; but wisdom not of this world, nor of the rulers of this world, who come to nought.
content_old: 6 But we speak wisdom among the perfect; but wisdom not of this world, nor of the rulers of this world, who come to nought.

content: 7 But we speak God’s wisdom in a mystery, that hidden wisdom which God had predetermined before the ages for our glory:
content_old: 7 But we speak God’s wisdom in a mystery, that hidden wisdom which God had predetermined before the ages for our glory:

content: 8 which none of the princes of this age knew, (for had they known, they would not have crucified the Lord of glory;)
content_old: 8 which none of the princes of this age knew, (for had they known, they would not have crucified the Lord of glory;)

content: 9 but according as it is written, Things which eye has not seen, and ear not heard, and which have not come into man’s heart, which God has prepared for them that love him,
content_old: 9 but according as it is written, Things which eye has not seen, and ear not heard, and which have not come into man’s heart, which God has prepared for them that love him,

content: 10 but God has revealed to us by his Spirit; for the Spirit searches all things, even the depths of God.
content_old: 10 but God has revealed to us by his Spirit; for the Spirit searches all things, even the depths of God.

content: 11 For who of men hath known the things of a man except the spirit of the man which is in him? thus also the things of God knows no one except the Spirit of God.
content_old: 11 For who of men hath known the things of a man except the spirit of the man which is in him? thus also the things of God knows no one except the Spirit of God.

content: 12 But we have received, not the spirit of the world, but the Spirit which is of God, that we may know the things which have been freely given to us of God:
content_old: 12 But we have received, not the spirit of the world, but the Spirit which is of God, that we may know the things which have been freely given to us of God:

content: 13 which also we speak, not in words taught by human wisdom, but in those taught by the Spirit, communicating spiritual things by spiritual means.
content_old: 13 which also we speak, not in words taught by human wisdom, but in those taught by the Spirit, communicating spiritual things by spiritual means.

content: 14 But the natural man does not receive the things of the Spirit of God, for they are folly to him; and he cannot know them because they are spiritually discerned;
content_old: 14 But the natural man does not receive the things of the Spirit of God, for they are folly to him; and he cannot know them because they are spiritually discerned;

content: 15 but the spiritual discerns all things, and he is discerned of no one.
content_old: 15 but the spiritual discerns all things, and he is discerned of no one.

content: 1 And I, brethren, have not been able to speak to you as to spiritual, but as to fleshly; as to babes in Christ.
content_old: 1 And I, brethren, have not been able to speak to you as to spiritual, but as to fleshly; as to babes in Christ.

content: 2 I have given you milk to drink, not meat, for ye have not yet been able, nor indeed are ye yet able;
content_old: 2 I have given you milk to drink, not meat, for ye have not yet been able, nor indeed are ye yet able;

content: 3 for ye are yet carnal. For whereas there are among you emulation and strife, are ye not carnal, and walk according to man?
content_old: 3 for ye are yet carnal. For whereas there are among you emulation and strife, are ye not carnal, and walk according to man?

content: 4 For when one says, I am of Paul, and another, I of Apollos, are ye not men?
content_old: 4 For when one says, I am of Paul, and another, I of Apollos, are ye not men?

content: 5 Who then is Apollos, and who Paul? Ministering servants, through whom ye have believed, and as the Lord has given to each.
content_old: 5 Who then is Apollos, and who Paul? Ministering servants, through whom ye have believed, and as the Lord has given to each.

content: 6 I have planted; Apollos watered; but God has given the increase.
content_old: 6 I have planted; Apollos watered; but God has given the increase.

content: 7 So that neither the planter is anything, nor the waterer; but God the giver of the increase.
content_old: 7 So that neither the planter is anything, nor the waterer; but God the giver of the increase.

content: 8 But the planter and the waterer are one; but each shall receive his own reward according to his own labour.
content_old: 8 But the planter and the waterer are one; but each shall receive his own reward according to his own labour.

content: 9 For we are God’s fellow-workmen; ye are God’s husbandry, God’s building.
content_old: 9 For we are God’s fellow-workmen; ye are God’s husbandry, God’s building.

content: 10 According to the grace of God which has been given to me, as a wise architect, I have laid the foundation, but another builds upon it. But let each see how he builds upon it.
content_old: 10 According to the grace of God which has been given to me, as a wise architect, I have laid the foundation, but another builds upon it. But let each see how he builds upon it.

content: 11 For other foundation can no man lay besides that which is laid, which is Jesus Christ.
content_old: 11 For other foundation can no man lay besides that which is laid, which is Jesus Christ.

content: 12 Now if any one build upon this foundation, gold, silver, precious stones, wood, grass, straw,
content_old: 12 Now if any one build upon this foundation, gold, silver, precious stones, wood, grass, straw,

content: 13 the work of each shall be made manifest; for the day shall declare it, because it is revealed in fire; and the fire shall try the work of each what it is.
content_old: 13 the work of each shall be made manifest; for the day shall declare it, because it is revealed in fire; and the fire shall try the work of each what it is.

content: 14 If the work of any one which he has built upon the foundation shall abide, he shall receive a reward.
content_old: 14 If the work of any one which he has built upon the foundation shall abide, he shall receive a reward.

content: 15 If the work of any one shall be consumed, he shall suffer loss, but he shall be saved, but so as through the fire.
content_old: 15 If the work of any one shall be consumed, he shall suffer loss, but he shall be saved, but so as through the fire.

content: 16 Do ye not know that ye are the temple of God, and that the Spirit of God dwells in you?
content_old: 16 Do ye not know that ye are the temple of God, and that the Spirit of God dwells in you?

content: 17 If any one corrupt the temple of God, him shall God destroy; for the temple of God is holy, and such are ye.
content_old: 17 If any one corrupt the temple of God, him shall God destroy; for the temple of God is holy, and such are ye.

content: 18 Let no one deceive himself: if any one thinks himself to be wise among you in this world, let him become foolish, that he may be wise.
content_old: 18 Let no one deceive himself: if any one thinks himself to be wise among you in this world, let him become foolish, that he may be wise.

content: 19 For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God; for it is written, He who takes the wise in their craftiness.
content_old: 19 For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God; for it is written, He who takes the wise in their craftiness.

content: 20 And again, The Lord knows the reasonings of the wise that they are vain.
content_old: 20 And again, The Lord knows the reasonings of the wise that they are vain.

content: 21 So that let no one boast in men; for all things are yours.
content_old: 21 So that let no one boast in men; for all things are yours.

content: 22 Whether Paul, or Apollos, or Cephas, or the world, or life, or death, or things present, or things coming, all are yours;
content_old: 22 Whether Paul, or Apollos, or Cephas, or the world, or life, or death, or things present, or things coming, all are yours;

content: 1 Let a man so account of us as servants of Christ, and stewards of the mysteries of God.
content_old: 1 Let a man so account of us as servants of Christ, and stewards of the mysteries of God.

content: 2 Here, further, it is sought in stewards, that a man be found faithful.
content_old: 2 Here, further, it is sought in stewards, that a man be found faithful.

content: 3 But for me it is the very smallest matter that I be examined of you or of man’s day. Nor do I even examine myself.
content_old: 3 But for me it is the very smallest matter that I be examined of you or of man’s day. Nor do I even examine myself.

content: 4 For I am conscious of nothing in myself; but I am not justified by this: but he that examines me is the Lord.
content_old: 4 For I am conscious of nothing in myself; but I am not justified by this: but he that examines me is the Lord.

content: 5 So that do not judge anything before the time, until the Lord shall come, who shall also both bring to light the hidden things of darkness, and shall make manifest the counsels of hearts; and then shall each have his praise from God.
content_old: 5 So that do not judge anything before the time, until the Lord shall come, who shall also both bring to light the hidden things of darkness, and shall make manifest the counsels of hearts; and then shall each have his praise from God.

content: 6 Now these things, brethren, I have transferred, in their application, to myself and Apollos, for your sakes, that ye may learn in us the lesson of not letting your thoughts go above what is written, that ye may not be puffed up one for such a one against another.
content_old: 6 Now these things, brethren, I have transferred, in their application, to myself and Apollos, for your sakes, that ye may learn in us the lesson of not letting your thoughts go above what is written, that ye may not be puffed up one for such a one against another.

content: 7 For who makes thee to differ? and what hast thou which thou hast not received? but if also thou hast received, why boastest thou as not receiving?
content_old: 7 For who makes thee to differ? and what hast thou which thou hast not received? but if also thou hast received, why boastest thou as not receiving?

content: 8 Already ye are filled; already ye have been enriched; ye have reigned without us; and I would that ye reigned, that we also might reign with you.
content_old: 8 Already ye are filled; already ye have been enriched; ye have reigned without us; and I would that ye reigned, that we also might reign with you.

content: 9 For I think that God has set us the apostles for the last, as appointed to death. For we have become a spectacle to the world, both to angels and men.
content_old: 9 For I think that God has set us the apostles for the last, as appointed to death. For we have become a spectacle to the world, both to angels and men.

content: 10 We are fools for Christ’s sake, but ye prudent in Christ: we weak, but ye strong: ye glorious, but we in dishonour.
content_old: 10 We are fools for Christ’s sake, but ye prudent in Christ: we weak, but ye strong: ye glorious, but we in dishonour.

content: 11 To the present hour we both hunger and thirst, and are in nakedness, and buffeted, and wander without a home,
content_old: 11 To the present hour we both hunger and thirst, and are in nakedness, and buffeted, and wander without a home,

content: 12 and labour, working with our own hands. Railed at, we bless; persecuted, we suffer it;
content_old: 12 and labour, working with our own hands. Railed at, we bless; persecuted, we suffer it;

content: 13 insulted, we entreat: we are become as the offscouring of the world, the refuse of all, until now.
content_old: 13 insulted, we entreat: we are become as the offscouring of the world, the refuse of all, until now.

content: 14 Not as chiding do I write these things to you, but as my beloved children I admonish you.
content_old: 14 Not as chiding do I write these things to you, but as my beloved children I admonish you.

content: 15 For if ye should have ten thousand instructors in Christ, yet not many fathers; for in Christ Jesus I have begotten you through the glad tidings.
content_old: 15 For if ye should have ten thousand instructors in Christ, yet not many fathers; for in Christ Jesus I have begotten you through the glad tidings.

content: 16 I entreat you therefore, be my imitators.
content_old: 16 I entreat you therefore, be my imitators.

content: 17 For this reason I have sent to you Timotheus, who is my beloved and faithful child in the Lord, who shall put you in mind of my ways as they are in Christ, according as I teach everywhere in every assembly.
content_old: 17 For this reason I have sent to you Timotheus, who is my beloved and faithful child in the Lord, who shall put you in mind of my ways as they are in Christ, according as I teach everywhere in every assembly.

content: 18 But some have been puffed up, as if I were not coming to you;
content_old: 18 But some have been puffed up, as if I were not coming to you;

content: 19 but I will come quickly to you, if the Lord will; and I will know, not the word of those that are puffed up, but the power.
content_old: 19 but I will come quickly to you, if the Lord will; and I will know, not the word of those that are puffed up, but the power.

content: 20 For the kingdom of God is not in word, but in power.
content_old: 20 For the kingdom of God is not in word, but in power.

content: 1 It is universally reported that there is fornication among you, and such fornication as is not even among the nations, so that one should have his father’s wife.
content_old: 1 It is universally reported that there is fornication among you, and such fornication as is not even among the nations, so that one should have his father’s wife.

content: 2 And ye are puffed up, and ye have not rather mourned, in order that he that has done this deed might be taken away out of the midst of you.
content_old: 2 And ye are puffed up, and ye have not rather mourned, in order that he that has done this deed might be taken away out of the midst of you.

content: 3 For I, as absent in body but present in spirit, have already judged as present,
content_old: 3 For I, as absent in body but present in spirit, have already judged as present,

content: 4 to deliver, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ (ye and my spirit being gathered together, with the power of our Lord Jesus Christ), him that has so wrought this:
content_old: 4 to deliver, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ (ye and my spirit being gathered together, with the power of our Lord Jesus Christ), him that has so wrought this:

content: 5 to deliver him, I say, being such, to Satan for destruction of the flesh, that the spirit may be saved in the day of the Lord Jesus.
content_old: 5 to deliver him, I say, being such, to Satan for destruction of the flesh, that the spirit may be saved in the day of the Lord Jesus.

content: 6 Your boasting is not good. Do ye not know that a little leaven leavens the whole lump?
content_old: 6 Your boasting is not good. Do ye not know that a little leaven leavens the whole lump?

content: 7 Purge out the old leaven, that ye may be a new lump, according as ye are unleavened. For also our passover, Christ, has been sacrificed;
content_old: 7 Purge out the old leaven, that ye may be a new lump, according as ye are unleavened. For also our passover, Christ, has been sacrificed;

content: 8 so that let us celebrate the feast, not with old leaven, nor with leaven of malice and wickedness, but with unleavened bread of sincerity and truth.
content_old: 8 so that let us celebrate the feast, not with old leaven, nor with leaven of malice and wickedness, but with unleavened bread of sincerity and truth.

content: 9 I have written to you in the epistle not to mix with fornicators;
content_old: 9 I have written to you in the epistle not to mix with fornicators;

content: 10 not altogether with the fornicators of this world, or with the avaricious and rapacious, or idolaters, since then ye should go out of the world.
content_old: 10 not altogether with the fornicators of this world, or with the avaricious and rapacious, or idolaters, since then ye should go out of the world.

content: 11 But now I have written to you, if any one called brother be fornicator, or avaricious, or idolater, or abusive, or a drunkard, or rapacious, not to mix with him; with such a one not even to eat.
content_old: 11 But now I have written to you, if any one called brother be fornicator, or avaricious, or idolater, or abusive, or a drunkard, or rapacious, not to mix with him; with such a one not even to eat.

content: 12 For what have I to do with judging those outside also? ye, do not ye judge them that are within?
content_old: 12 For what have I to do with judging those outside also? ye, do not ye judge them that are within?

content: 1 Dare any one of you, having a matter against another, prosecute his suit before the unjust, and not before the saints?
content_old: 1 Dare any one of you, having a matter against another, prosecute his suit before the unjust, and not before the saints?

content: 2 Do ye not then know that the saints shall judge the world? and if the world is judged by you, are ye unworthy of the smallest judgments?
content_old: 2 Do ye not then know that the saints shall judge the world? and if the world is judged by you, are ye unworthy of the smallest judgments?

content: 3 Do ye not know that we shall judge angels? and not then matters of this life?
content_old: 3 Do ye not know that we shall judge angels? and not then matters of this life?

content: 4 If then ye have judgments as to things of this life, set those to judge who are little esteemed in the assembly.
content_old: 4 If then ye have judgments as to things of this life, set those to judge who are little esteemed in the assembly.

content: 5 I speak to you to put you to shame. Thus there is not a wise person among you, not even one, who shall be able to decide between his brethren!
content_old: 5 I speak to you to put you to shame. Thus there is not a wise person among you, not even one, who shall be able to decide between his brethren!

content: 6 But brother prosecutes his suit with brother, and that before unbelievers.
content_old: 6 But brother prosecutes his suit with brother, and that before unbelievers.

content: 7 Already indeed then it is altogether a fault in you that ye have suits between yourselves. Why do ye not rather suffer wrong? why are ye not rather defrauded?
content_old: 7 Already indeed then it is altogether a fault in you that ye have suits between yourselves. Why do ye not rather suffer wrong? why are ye not rather defrauded?

content: 8 But ye do wrong, and defraud, and this your brethren.
content_old: 8 But ye do wrong, and defraud, and this your brethren.

content: 9 Do ye not know that unrighteous persons shall not inherit the kingdom of God? Do not err: neither fornicators, nor idolaters, nor adulterers, nor those who make women of themselves, nor who abuse themselves with men,
content_old: 9 Do ye not know that unrighteous persons shall not inherit the kingdom of God? Do not err: neither fornicators, nor idolaters, nor adulterers, nor those who make women of themselves, nor who abuse themselves with men,

content: 10 nor thieves, nor covetous, nor drunkards, nor abusive persons, nor the rapacious, shall inherit the kingdom of God.
content_old: 10 nor thieves, nor covetous, nor drunkards, nor abusive persons, nor the rapacious, shall inherit the kingdom of God.

content: 11 And these things were some of you; but ye have been washed, but ye have been sanctified, but ye have been justified in the name of the Lord Jesus, and by the Spirit of our God.
content_old: 11 And these things were some of you; but ye have been washed, but ye have been sanctified, but ye have been justified in the name of the Lord Jesus, and by the Spirit of our God.

content: 12 All things are lawful to me, but all things do not profit; all things are lawful to me, but I will not be brought under the power of any.
content_old: 12 All things are lawful to me, but all things do not profit; all things are lawful to me, but I will not be brought under the power of any.

content: 13 Meats for the belly, and the belly for meats; but God will bring to nothing both it and them: but the body is not for fornication, but for the Lord, and the Lord for the body.
content_old: 13 Meats for the belly, and the belly for meats; but God will bring to nothing both it and them: but the body is not for fornication, but for the Lord, and the Lord for the body.

content: 14 And God has both raised up the Lord, and will raise us up from among the dead by his power.
content_old: 14 And God has both raised up the Lord, and will raise us up from among the dead by his power.

content: 15 Do ye not know that your bodies are members of Christ? Shall I then, taking the members of the Christ, make them members of a harlot? Far be the thought.
content_old: 15 Do ye not know that your bodies are members of Christ? Shall I then, taking the members of the Christ, make them members of a harlot? Far be the thought.

content: 16 Do ye not know that he that is joined to the harlot is one body? for the two, he says, shall be one flesh.
content_old: 16 Do ye not know that he that is joined to the harlot is one body? for the two, he says, shall be one flesh.

content: 17 But he that is joined to the Lord is one Spirit.
content_old: 17 But he that is joined to the Lord is one Spirit.

content: 18 Flee fornication. Every sin which a man may practise is without the body, but he that commits fornication sins against his own body.
content_old: 18 Flee fornication. Every sin which a man may practise is without the body, but he that commits fornication sins against his own body.

content: 19 Do ye not know that your body is the temple of the Holy Spirit which is in you, which ye have of God; and ye are not your own?
content_old: 19 Do ye not know that your body is the temple of the Holy Spirit which is in you, which ye have of God; and ye are not your own?

content: 1 But concerning the things of which ye have written to me: It is good for a man not to touch a woman;
content_old: 1 But concerning the things of which ye have written to me: It is good for a man not to touch a woman;

content: 2 but on account of fornications, let each have his own wife, and each woman have her own husband.
content_old: 2 but on account of fornications, let each have his own wife, and each woman have her own husband.

content: 3 Let the husband render her due to the wife, and in like manner the wife to the husband.
content_old: 3 Let the husband render her due to the wife, and in like manner the wife to the husband.

content: 4 The wife has not authority over her own body, but the husband: in like manner also the husband has not authority over his own body, but the wife.
content_old: 4 The wife has not authority over her own body, but the husband: in like manner also the husband has not authority over his own body, but the wife.

content: 5 Defraud not one another, unless, it may be, by consent for a time, that ye may devote yourselves to prayer, and again be together, that Satan tempt you not because of your incontinency.
content_old: 5 Defraud not one another, unless, it may be, by consent for a time, that ye may devote yourselves to prayer, and again be together, that Satan tempt you not because of your incontinency.

content: 6 But this I say, as consenting to, not as commanding it.
content_old: 6 But this I say, as consenting to, not as commanding it.

content: 7 Now I wish all men to be even as myself: but every one has his own gift of God: one man thus, and another thus.
content_old: 7 Now I wish all men to be even as myself: but every one has his own gift of God: one man thus, and another thus.

content: 8 But I say to the unmarried and to the widows, It is good for them that they remain even as I.
content_old: 8 But I say to the unmarried and to the widows, It is good for them that they remain even as I.

content: 9 But if they have not control over themselves, let them marry; for it is better to marry than to burn.
content_old: 9 But if they have not control over themselves, let them marry; for it is better to marry than to burn.

content: 10 But to the married I enjoin, not I, but the Lord, Let not wife be separated from husband;
content_old: 10 But to the married I enjoin, not I, but the Lord, Let not wife be separated from husband;

content: 11 (but if also she shall have been separated, let her remain unmarried, or be reconciled to her husband;) and let not husband leave wife.
content_old: 11 (but if also she shall have been separated, let her remain unmarried, or be reconciled to her husband;) and let not husband leave wife.

content: 12 But as to the rest, I say, not the Lord, If any brother have an unbelieving wife, and she consent to dwell with him, let him not leave her.
content_old: 12 But as to the rest, I say, not the Lord, If any brother have an unbelieving wife, and she consent to dwell with him, let him not leave her.

content: 13 And a woman who has an unbelieving husband, and he consents to dwell with her, let her not leave her husband.
content_old: 13 And a woman who has an unbelieving husband, and he consents to dwell with her, let her not leave her husband.

content: 14 For the unbelieving husband is sanctified in the wife, and the unbelieving wife is sanctified in the brother; since otherwise indeed your children are unclean, but now they are holy.
content_old: 14 For the unbelieving husband is sanctified in the wife, and the unbelieving wife is sanctified in the brother; since otherwise indeed your children are unclean, but now they are holy.

content: 15 But if the unbeliever go away, let them go away; a brother or a sister is not bound in such cases, but God has called us in peace.
content_old: 15 But if the unbeliever go away, let them go away; a brother or a sister is not bound in such cases, but God has called us in peace.

content: 16 For what knowest thou, O wife, if thou shalt save thy husband? or what knowest thou, O husband, if thou shalt save thy wife?
content_old: 16 For what knowest thou, O wife, if thou shalt save thy husband? or what knowest thou, O husband, if thou shalt save thy wife?

content: 17 However, as the Lord has divided to each, as God has called each, so let him walk; and thus I ordain in all the assemblies.
content_old: 17 However, as the Lord has divided to each, as God has called each, so let him walk; and thus I ordain in all the assemblies.

content: 18 Has any one been called circumcised? let him not become uncircumcised: has any one been called in uncircumcision? let him not be circumcised.
content_old: 18 Has any one been called circumcised? let him not become uncircumcised: has any one been called in uncircumcision? let him not be circumcised.

content: 19 Circumcision is nothing, and uncircumcision is nothing; but keeping God’s commandments.
content_old: 19 Circumcision is nothing, and uncircumcision is nothing; but keeping God’s commandments.

content: 20 Let each abide in that calling in which he has been called.
content_old: 20 Let each abide in that calling in which he has been called.

content: 21 Hast thou been called being a bondman, let it not concern thee; but and if thou canst become free, use it rather.
content_old: 21 Hast thou been called being a bondman, let it not concern thee; but and if thou canst become free, use it rather.

content: 22 For the bondman that is called in the Lord is the Lord’s freedman; in like manner also the freeman being called is Christ’s bondman.
content_old: 22 For the bondman that is called in the Lord is the Lord’s freedman; in like manner also the freeman being called is Christ’s bondman.

content: 23 Ye have been bought with a price; do not be the bondmen of men.
content_old: 23 Ye have been bought with a price; do not be the bondmen of men.

content: 24 Let each, wherein he is called, brethren, therein abide with God.
content_old: 24 Let each, wherein he is called, brethren, therein abide with God.

content: 25 But concerning virgins, I have no commandment of the Lord; but I give my opinion, as having received mercy of the Lord to be faithful.
content_old: 25 But concerning virgins, I have no commandment of the Lord; but I give my opinion, as having received mercy of the Lord to be faithful.

content: 26 I think then that this is good, on account of the present necessity, that it is good for a man to remain so as he is.
content_old: 26 I think then that this is good, on account of the present necessity, that it is good for a man to remain so as he is.

content: 27 Art thou bound to a wife? seek not to be loosed; art thou free from a wife? do not seek a wife.
content_old: 27 Art thou bound to a wife? seek not to be loosed; art thou free from a wife? do not seek a wife.

content: 28 But if thou shouldest also marry, thou hast not sinned; and if the virgin marry, they have not sinned: but such shall have tribulation in the flesh; but I spare you.
content_old: 28 But if thou shouldest also marry, thou hast not sinned; and if the virgin marry, they have not sinned: but such shall have tribulation in the flesh; but I spare you.

content: 29 But this I say, brethren, the time is straitened. For the rest, that they who have wives, be as not having any:
content_old: 29 But this I say, brethren, the time is straitened. For the rest, that they who have wives, be as not having any:

content: 30 and they that weep, as not weeping; and they that rejoice, as not rejoicing; and they that buy, as not possessing;
content_old: 30 and they that weep, as not weeping; and they that rejoice, as not rejoicing; and they that buy, as not possessing;

content: 31 and they that use the world, as not disposing of it as their own; for the fashion of this world passes.
content_old: 31 and they that use the world, as not disposing of it as their own; for the fashion of this world passes.

content: 32 But I wish you to be without care. The unmarried cares for the things of the Lord, how he shall please the Lord;
content_old: 32 But I wish you to be without care. The unmarried cares for the things of the Lord, how he shall please the Lord;

content: 33 but he that has married cares for the things of the world, how he shall please his wife.
content_old: 33 but he that has married cares for the things of the world, how he shall please his wife.

content: 34 There is a difference between the wife and the virgin. The unmarried cares for the things of the Lord, that she may be holy both in body and spirit; but she that has married cares for the things of the world, how she shall please her husband.
content_old: 34 There is a difference between the wife and the virgin. The unmarried cares for the things of the Lord, that she may be holy both in body and spirit; but she that has married cares for the things of the world, how she shall please her husband.

content: 35 But I say this for your own profit; not that I may set a snare before you, but for what is seemly, and waiting on the Lord without distraction.
content_old: 35 But I say this for your own profit; not that I may set a snare before you, but for what is seemly, and waiting on the Lord without distraction.

content: 36 But if any one think that he behaves unseemly to his virginity, if he be beyond the flower of his age, and so it must be, let him do what he will, he does not sin: let them marry.
content_old: 36 But if any one think that he behaves unseemly to his virginity, if he be beyond the flower of his age, and so it must be, let him do what he will, he does not sin: let them marry.

content: 37 But he who stands firm in his heart, having no need, but has authority over his own will, and has judged this in his heart to keep his own virginity, he does well.
content_old: 37 But he who stands firm in his heart, having no need, but has authority over his own will, and has judged this in his heart to keep his own virginity, he does well.

content: 38 So that he that marries himself does well; and he that does not marry does better.
content_old: 38 So that he that marries himself does well; and he that does not marry does better.

content: 39 A wife is bound for whatever time her husband lives; but if the husband be fallen asleep, she is free to be married to whom she will, only in the Lord.
content_old: 39 A wife is bound for whatever time her husband lives; but if the husband be fallen asleep, she is free to be married to whom she will, only in the Lord.

content: 1 But concerning things sacrificed to idols, we know, (for we all have knowledge: knowledge puffs up, but love edifies.
content_old: 1 But concerning things sacrificed to idols, we know, (for we all have knowledge: knowledge puffs up, but love edifies.

content: 2 If any one think he knows anything, he knows nothing yet as he ought to know it.
content_old: 2 If any one think he knows anything, he knows nothing yet as he ought to know it.

content: 3 But if any one love God, he is known of him):
content_old: 3 But if any one love God, he is known of him):

content: 4 —concerning then the eating of things sacrificed to idols, we know that an idol is nothing in the world, and that there is no other God save one.
content_old: 4 —concerning then the eating of things sacrificed to idols, we know that an idol is nothing in the world, and that there is no other God save one.

content: 5 For and if indeed there are those called gods, whether in heaven or on earth, (as there are gods many, and lords many,)
content_old: 5 For and if indeed there are those called gods, whether in heaven or on earth, (as there are gods many, and lords many,)

content: 6 yet to us there is one God, the Father, of whom all things, and we for him; and one Lord, Jesus Christ, by whom are all things, and we by him.
content_old: 6 yet to us there is one God, the Father, of whom all things, and we for him; and one Lord, Jesus Christ, by whom are all things, and we by him.

content: 7 But knowledge is not in all: but some, with conscience of the idol, until now eat as of a thing sacrificed to idols; and their conscience, being weak, is defiled.
content_old: 7 But knowledge is not in all: but some, with conscience of the idol, until now eat as of a thing sacrificed to idols; and their conscience, being weak, is defiled.

content: 8 But meat does not commend us to God; neither if we should not eat do we come short; nor if we should eat have we an advantage.
content_old: 8 But meat does not commend us to God; neither if we should not eat do we come short; nor if we should eat have we an advantage.

content: 9 But see lest anywise this your right to eat itself be a stumbling-block to the weak.
content_old: 9 But see lest anywise this your right to eat itself be a stumbling-block to the weak.

content: 10 For if any one see thee, who hast knowledge, sitting at table in an idol-house, shall not his conscience, he being weak, be emboldened to eat the things sacrificed to the idol?
content_old: 10 For if any one see thee, who hast knowledge, sitting at table in an idol-house, shall not his conscience, he being weak, be emboldened to eat the things sacrificed to the idol?

content: 11 and the weak one, the brother for whose sake Christ died, will perish through thy knowledge.
content_old: 11 and the weak one, the brother for whose sake Christ died, will perish through thy knowledge.

content: 12 Now, thus sinning against the brethren, and wounding their weak conscience, ye sin against Christ.
content_old: 12 Now, thus sinning against the brethren, and wounding their weak conscience, ye sin against Christ.

content: 1 Am I not free? am I not an apostle? have I not seen Jesus our Lord? are not ye my work in the Lord?
content_old: 1 Am I not free? am I not an apostle? have I not seen Jesus our Lord? are not ye my work in the Lord?

content: 2 If I am not an apostle to others, yet at any rate I am to you: for the seal of mine apostleship are ye in the Lord.
content_old: 2 If I am not an apostle to others, yet at any rate I am to you: for the seal of mine apostleship are ye in the Lord.

content: 3 My defence to those who examine me is this:
content_old: 3 My defence to those who examine me is this:

content: 4 Have we not a right to eat and to drink?
content_old: 4 Have we not a right to eat and to drink?

content: 5 have we not a right to take round a sister as wife, as also the other apostles, and the brethren of the Lord, and Cephas?
content_old: 5 have we not a right to take round a sister as wife, as also the other apostles, and the brethren of the Lord, and Cephas?

content: 6 Or I alone and Barnabas, have we not a right not to work?
content_old: 6 Or I alone and Barnabas, have we not a right not to work?

content: 7 Who ever carries on war at his own charges? who plants a vineyard and does not eat of its fruit? or who herds a flock and does not eat of the milk of the flock?
content_old: 7 Who ever carries on war at his own charges? who plants a vineyard and does not eat of its fruit? or who herds a flock and does not eat of the milk of the flock?

content: 8 Do I speak these things as a man, or does not the law also say these things?
content_old: 8 Do I speak these things as a man, or does not the law also say these things?

content: 9 For in the law of Moses it is written, Thou shalt not muzzle the ox that is treading out corn. Is God occupied about the oxen,
content_old: 9 For in the law of Moses it is written, Thou shalt not muzzle the ox that is treading out corn. Is God occupied about the oxen,

content: 10 or does he say it altogether for our sakes? For for our sakes it has been written, that the plougher should plough in hope, and he that treads out corn, in hope of partaking of it.
content_old: 10 or does he say it altogether for our sakes? For for our sakes it has been written, that the plougher should plough in hope, and he that treads out corn, in hope of partaking of it.

content: 11 If we have sown to you spiritual things, is it a great thing if we shall reap your carnal things?
content_old: 11 If we have sown to you spiritual things, is it a great thing if we shall reap your carnal things?

content: 12 If others partake of this right over you, should not rather we? But we have not used this right, but we bear all things, that we may put no hindrance in the way of the glad tidings of the Christ.
content_old: 12 If others partake of this right over you, should not rather we? But we have not used this right, but we bear all things, that we may put no hindrance in the way of the glad tidings of the Christ.

content: 13 Do ye not know that they who labour at sacred things eat of the offerings offered in the temple; they that attend at the altar partake with the altar?
content_old: 13 Do ye not know that they who labour at sacred things eat of the offerings offered in the temple; they that attend at the altar partake with the altar?

content: 14 So also the Lord has ordained to those that announce the glad tidings to live of the glad tidings.
content_old: 14 So also the Lord has ordained to those that announce the glad tidings to live of the glad tidings.

content: 15 But I have used none of these things. Now I have not written these things that it should be thus in my case; for it were good for me rather to die than that any one should make vain my boast.
content_old: 15 But I have used none of these things. Now I have not written these things that it should be thus in my case; for it were good for me rather to die than that any one should make vain my boast.

content: 16 For if I announce the glad tidings, I have nothing to boast of; for a necessity is laid upon me; for it is woe to me if I should not announce the glad tidings.
content_old: 16 For if I announce the glad tidings, I have nothing to boast of; for a necessity is laid upon me; for it is woe to me if I should not announce the glad tidings.

content: 17 For if I do this voluntarily, I have a reward; but if not of my own will, I am entrusted with an administration.
content_old: 17 For if I do this voluntarily, I have a reward; but if not of my own will, I am entrusted with an administration.

content: 18 What is the reward then that I have? That in announcing the glad tidings I make the glad tidings costless to others, so as not to have made use, as belonging to me, of my right in announcing the glad tidings.
content_old: 18 What is the reward then that I have? That in announcing the glad tidings I make the glad tidings costless to others, so as not to have made use, as belonging to me, of my right in announcing the glad tidings.

content: 19 For being free from all, I have made myself bondman to all, that I might gain the most possible.
content_old: 19 For being free from all, I have made myself bondman to all, that I might gain the most possible.

content: 20 And I became to the Jews as a Jew, in order that I might gain the Jews: to those under law, as under law, not being myself under law, in order that I might gain those under law:
content_old: 20 And I became to the Jews as a Jew, in order that I might gain the Jews: to those under law, as under law, not being myself under law, in order that I might gain those under law:

content: 21 to those without law, as without law, (not as without law to God, but as legitimately subject to Christ,) in order that I might gain those without law.
content_old: 21 to those without law, as without law, (not as without law to God, but as legitimately subject to Christ,) in order that I might gain those without law.

content: 22 I became to the weak, as weak, in order that I might gain the weak. To all I have become all things, in order that at all events I might save some.
content_old: 22 I became to the weak, as weak, in order that I might gain the weak. To all I have become all things, in order that at all events I might save some.

content: 23 And I do all things for the sake of the glad tidings, that I may be fellow-partaker with them.
content_old: 23 And I do all things for the sake of the glad tidings, that I may be fellow-partaker with them.

content: 24 Know ye not that they who run in the race-course run all, but one receives the prize? Thus run in order that ye may obtain.
content_old: 24 Know ye not that they who run in the race-course run all, but one receives the prize? Thus run in order that ye may obtain.

content: 25 But every one that contends for a prize is temperate in all things: they then indeed that they may receive a corruptible crown, but we an incorruptible.
content_old: 25 But every one that contends for a prize is temperate in all things: they then indeed that they may receive a corruptible crown, but we an incorruptible.

content: 26 I therefore thus run, as not uncertainly; so I combat, as not beating the air.
content_old: 26 I therefore thus run, as not uncertainly; so I combat, as not beating the air.

content: 1 For I would not have you ignorant, brethren, that all our fathers were under the cloud, and all passed through the sea;
content_old: 1 For I would not have you ignorant, brethren, that all our fathers were under the cloud, and all passed through the sea;

content: 2 and all were baptised unto Moses in the cloud and in the sea;
content_old: 2 and all were baptised unto Moses in the cloud and in the sea;

content: 3 and all ate the same spiritual food,
content_old: 3 and all ate the same spiritual food,

content: 4 and all drank the same spiritual drink, for they drank of a spiritual rock which followed them: (now the rock was the Christ;)
content_old: 4 and all drank the same spiritual drink, for they drank of a spiritual rock which followed them: (now the rock was the Christ;)

content: 5 yet God was not pleased with the most of them, for they were strewed in the desert.
content_old: 5 yet God was not pleased with the most of them, for they were strewed in the desert.

content: 6 But these things happened as types of us, that we should not be lusters after evil things, as they also lusted.
content_old: 6 But these things happened as types of us, that we should not be lusters after evil things, as they also lusted.

content: 7 Neither be ye idolaters, as some of them; as it is written, The people sat down to eat and to drink, and rose up to play.
content_old: 7 Neither be ye idolaters, as some of them; as it is written, The people sat down to eat and to drink, and rose up to play.

content: 8 Neither let us commit fornication, as some of them committed fornication, and fell in one day three and twenty thousand.
content_old: 8 Neither let us commit fornication, as some of them committed fornication, and fell in one day three and twenty thousand.

content: 9 Neither let us tempt the Christ, as some of them tempted, and perished by serpents.
content_old: 9 Neither let us tempt the Christ, as some of them tempted, and perished by serpents.

content: 10 Neither murmur ye, as some of them murmured, and perished by the destroyer.
content_old: 10 Neither murmur ye, as some of them murmured, and perished by the destroyer.

content: 11 Now all these things happened to them as types, and have been written for our admonition, upon whom the ends of the ages are come.
content_old: 11 Now all these things happened to them as types, and have been written for our admonition, upon whom the ends of the ages are come.

content: 12 So that let him that thinks that he stands take heed lest he fall.
content_old: 12 So that let him that thinks that he stands take heed lest he fall.

content: 13 No temptation has taken you but such as is according to man’s nature; and God is faithful, who will not suffer you to be tempted above what ye are able to bear, but will with the temptation make the issue also, so that ye should be able to bear it.
content_old: 13 No temptation has taken you but such as is according to man’s nature; and God is faithful, who will not suffer you to be tempted above what ye are able to bear, but will with the temptation make the issue also, so that ye should be able to bear it.

content: 14 Wherefore, my beloved, flee from idolatry.
content_old: 14 Wherefore, my beloved, flee from idolatry.

content: 15 I speak as to intelligent persons: do ye judge what I say.
content_old: 15 I speak as to intelligent persons: do ye judge what I say.

content: 16 The cup of blessing which we bless, is it not the communion of the blood of the Christ? The bread which we break, is it not the communion of the body of the Christ?
content_old: 16 The cup of blessing which we bless, is it not the communion of the blood of the Christ? The bread which we break, is it not the communion of the body of the Christ?

content: 17 Because we, being many, are one loaf, one body; for we all partake of that one loaf.
content_old: 17 Because we, being many, are one loaf, one body; for we all partake of that one loaf.

content: 18 See Israel according to flesh: are not they who eat the sacrifices in communion with the altar?
content_old: 18 See Israel according to flesh: are not they who eat the sacrifices in communion with the altar?

content: 19 What then do I say? that what is sacrificed to an idol is anything, or that an idol is anything?
content_old: 19 What then do I say? that what is sacrificed to an idol is anything, or that an idol is anything?

content: 20 But that what the nations sacrifice they sacrifice to demons, and not to God. Now I do not wish you to be in communion with demons.
content_old: 20 But that what the nations sacrifice they sacrifice to demons, and not to God. Now I do not wish you to be in communion with demons.

content: 21 Ye cannot drink the Lord’s cup, and the cup of demons: ye cannot partake of the Lord’s table, and of the table of demons.
content_old: 21 Ye cannot drink the Lord’s cup, and the cup of demons: ye cannot partake of the Lord’s table, and of the table of demons.

content: 22 Do we provoke the Lord to jealousy? are we stronger than he?
content_old: 22 Do we provoke the Lord to jealousy? are we stronger than he?

content: 23 All things are lawful, but all are not profitable; all things are lawful, but all do not edify.
content_old: 23 All things are lawful, but all are not profitable; all things are lawful, but all do not edify.

content: 24 Let no one seek his own advantage, but that of the other.
content_old: 24 Let no one seek his own advantage, but that of the other.

content: 25 Everything sold in the shambles eat, making no inquiry for conscience sake.
content_old: 25 Everything sold in the shambles eat, making no inquiry for conscience sake.

content: 26 For the earth is the Lord’s and its fulness.
content_old: 26 For the earth is the Lord’s and its fulness.

content: 27 But if any one of the unbelievers invite you, and ye are minded to go, all that is set before you eat, making no inquiry for conscience sake.
content_old: 27 But if any one of the unbelievers invite you, and ye are minded to go, all that is set before you eat, making no inquiry for conscience sake.

content: 28 But if any one say to you, This is offered to holy purposes, do not eat, for his sake that pointed it out, and conscience sake;
content_old: 28 But if any one say to you, This is offered to holy purposes, do not eat, for his sake that pointed it out, and conscience sake;

content: 29 but conscience, I mean, not thine own, but that of the other: for why is my liberty judged by another conscience?
content_old: 29 but conscience, I mean, not thine own, but that of the other: for why is my liberty judged by another conscience?

content: 30 If I partake with thanksgiving, why am I spoken evil of for what I give thanks for?
content_old: 30 If I partake with thanksgiving, why am I spoken evil of for what I give thanks for?

content: 31 Whether therefore ye eat, or drink, or whatever ye do, do all things to God’s glory.
content_old: 31 Whether therefore ye eat, or drink, or whatever ye do, do all things to God’s glory.

content: 32 Give no occasion to stumbling, whether to Jews, or Greeks, or the assembly of God.
content_old: 32 Give no occasion to stumbling, whether to Jews, or Greeks, or the assembly of God.

content: 1 Be my imitators, even as I also am of Christ.
content_old: 1 Be my imitators, even as I also am of Christ.

content: 2 Now I praise you, that in all things ye are mindful of me; and that as I have directed you, ye keep the directions.
content_old: 2 Now I praise you, that in all things ye are mindful of me; and that as I have directed you, ye keep the directions.

content: 3 But I wish you to know that the Christ is the head of every man, but woman’s head is the man, and the Christ’s head God.
content_old: 3 But I wish you to know that the Christ is the head of every man, but woman’s head is the man, and the Christ’s head God.

content: 4 Every man praying or prophesying, having anything on his head, puts his head to shame.
content_old: 4 Every man praying or prophesying, having anything on his head, puts his head to shame.

content: 5 But every woman praying or prophesying with her head uncovered puts her own head to shame; for it is one and the same as a shaved woman.
content_old: 5 But every woman praying or prophesying with her head uncovered puts her own head to shame; for it is one and the same as a shaved woman.

content: 6 For if a woman be not covered, let her hair also be cut off. But if it be shameful to a woman to have her hair cut off or to be shaved, let her be covered.
content_old: 6 For if a woman be not covered, let her hair also be cut off. But if it be shameful to a woman to have her hair cut off or to be shaved, let her be covered.

content: 7 For man indeed ought not to have his head covered, being God’s image and glory; but woman is man’s glory.
content_old: 7 For man indeed ought not to have his head covered, being God’s image and glory; but woman is man’s glory.

content: 8 For man is not of woman, but woman of man.
content_old: 8 For man is not of woman, but woman of man.

content: 9 For also man was not created for the sake of the woman, but woman for the sake of the man.
content_old: 9 For also man was not created for the sake of the woman, but woman for the sake of the man.

content: 10 Therefore ought the woman to have authority on her head, on account of the angels.
content_old: 10 Therefore ought the woman to have authority on her head, on account of the angels.

content: 11 However, neither is woman without man, nor man without woman, in the Lord.
content_old: 11 However, neither is woman without man, nor man without woman, in the Lord.

content: 12 For as the woman is of the man, so also is the man by the woman, but all things of God.
content_old: 12 For as the woman is of the man, so also is the man by the woman, but all things of God.

content: 13 Judge in yourselves: is it comely that a woman should pray to God uncovered?
content_old: 13 Judge in yourselves: is it comely that a woman should pray to God uncovered?

content: 14 Does not even nature itself teach you, that man, if he have long hair, it is a dishonour to him?
content_old: 14 Does not even nature itself teach you, that man, if he have long hair, it is a dishonour to him?

content: 15 But woman, if she have long hair, it is glory to her; for the long hair is given to her in lieu of a veil.
content_old: 15 But woman, if she have long hair, it is glory to her; for the long hair is given to her in lieu of a veil.

content: 16 But if any one think to be contentious, we have no such custom, nor the assemblies of God.
content_old: 16 But if any one think to be contentious, we have no such custom, nor the assemblies of God.

content: 17 But in prescribing to you on this which I now enter on, I do not praise, namely, that ye come together, not for the better, but for the worse.
content_old: 17 But in prescribing to you on this which I now enter on, I do not praise, namely, that ye come together, not for the better, but for the worse.

content: 18 For first, when ye come together in assembly, I hear there exist divisions among you, and I partly give credit to it.
content_old: 18 For first, when ye come together in assembly, I hear there exist divisions among you, and I partly give credit to it.

content: 19 For there must also be sects among you, that the approved may become manifest among you.
content_old: 19 For there must also be sects among you, that the approved may become manifest among you.

content: 20 When ye come therefore together into one place, it is not to eat the Lord’s supper.
content_old: 20 When ye come therefore together into one place, it is not to eat the Lord’s supper.

content: 21 For each one in eating takes his own supper before others, and one is hungry and another drinks to excess.
content_old: 21 For each one in eating takes his own supper before others, and one is hungry and another drinks to excess.

content: 22 Have ye not then houses for eating and drinking? or do ye despise the assembly of God, and put to shame them who have not? What shall I say to you? shall I praise you? In this point I do not praise.
content_old: 22 Have ye not then houses for eating and drinking? or do ye despise the assembly of God, and put to shame them who have not? What shall I say to you? shall I praise you? In this point I do not praise.

content: 23 For I received from the Lord, that which I also delivered to you, that the Lord Jesus, in the night in which he was delivered up, took bread,
content_old: 23 For I received from the Lord, that which I also delivered to you, that the Lord Jesus, in the night in which he was delivered up, took bread,

content: 24 and having given thanks broke it, and said, This is my body, which is for you: this do in remembrance of me.
content_old: 24 and having given thanks broke it, and said, This is my body, which is for you: this do in remembrance of me.

content: 25 In like manner also the cup, after having supped, saying, This cup is the new covenant in my blood: this do, as often as ye shall drink it, in remembrance of me.
content_old: 25 In like manner also the cup, after having supped, saying, This cup is the new covenant in my blood: this do, as often as ye shall drink it, in remembrance of me.

content: 26 For as often as ye shall eat this bread, and drink the cup, ye announce the death of the Lord, until he come.
content_old: 26 For as often as ye shall eat this bread, and drink the cup, ye announce the death of the Lord, until he come.

content: 27 So that whosoever shall eat the bread, or drink the cup of the Lord, unworthily, shall be guilty in respect of the body and of the blood of the Lord.
content_old: 27 So that whosoever shall eat the bread, or drink the cup of the Lord, unworthily, shall be guilty in respect of the body and of the blood of the Lord.

content: 28 But let a man prove himself, and thus eat of the bread, and drink of the cup.
content_old: 28 But let a man prove himself, and thus eat of the bread, and drink of the cup.

content: 29 For the eater and drinker eats and drinks judgment to himself, not distinguishing the body.
content_old: 29 For the eater and drinker eats and drinks judgment to himself, not distinguishing the body.

content: 30 On this account many among you are weak and infirm, and a good many are fallen asleep.
content_old: 30 On this account many among you are weak and infirm, and a good many are fallen asleep.

content: 31 But if we judged ourselves, so were we not judged.
content_old: 31 But if we judged ourselves, so were we not judged.

content: 32 But being judged, we are disciplined of the Lord, that we may not be condemned with the world.
content_old: 32 But being judged, we are disciplined of the Lord, that we may not be condemned with the world.

content: 33 So that, my brethren, when ye come together to eat, wait for one another.
content_old: 33 So that, my brethren, when ye come together to eat, wait for one another.

content: 1 But concerning spiritual manifestations, brethren, I do not wish you to be ignorant.
content_old: 1 But concerning spiritual manifestations, brethren, I do not wish you to be ignorant.

content: 2 Ye know that when ye were of the nations ye were led away to dumb idols, in whatever way ye might be led.
content_old: 2 Ye know that when ye were of the nations ye were led away to dumb idols, in whatever way ye might be led.

content: 3 I give you therefore to know, that no one, speaking in the power of the Spirit of God, says, Curse on Jesus; and no one can say, Lord Jesus, unless in the power of the Holy Spirit.
content_old: 3 I give you therefore to know, that no one, speaking in the power of the Spirit of God, says, Curse on Jesus; and no one can say, Lord Jesus, unless in the power of the Holy Spirit.

content: 4 But there are distinctions of gifts, but the same Spirit;
content_old: 4 But there are distinctions of gifts, but the same Spirit;

content: 5 and there are distinctions of services, and the same Lord;
content_old: 5 and there are distinctions of services, and the same Lord;

content: 6 and there are distinctions of operations, but the same God who operates all things in all.
content_old: 6 and there are distinctions of operations, but the same God who operates all things in all.

content: 7 But to each the manifestation of the Spirit is given for profit.
content_old: 7 But to each the manifestation of the Spirit is given for profit.

content: 8 For to one, by the Spirit, is given the word of wisdom; and to another the word of knowledge, according to the same Spirit;
content_old: 8 For to one, by the Spirit, is given the word of wisdom; and to another the word of knowledge, according to the same Spirit;

content: 9 and to a different one faith, in the power of the same Spirit; and to another gifts of healing in the power of the same Spirit;
content_old: 9 and to a different one faith, in the power of the same Spirit; and to another gifts of healing in the power of the same Spirit;

content: 10 and to another operations of miracles; and to another prophecy; and to another discerning of spirits; and to a different one kinds of tongues; and to another interpretation of tongues.
content_old: 10 and to another operations of miracles; and to another prophecy; and to another discerning of spirits; and to a different one kinds of tongues; and to another interpretation of tongues.

content: 11 But all these things operates the one and the same Spirit, dividing to each in particular according as he pleases.
content_old: 11 But all these things operates the one and the same Spirit, dividing to each in particular according as he pleases.

content: 12 For even as the body is one and has many members, but all the members of the body, being many, are one body, so also is the Christ.
content_old: 12 For even as the body is one and has many members, but all the members of the body, being many, are one body, so also is the Christ.

content: 13 For also in the power of one Spirit we have all been baptised into one body, whether Jews or Greeks, whether bondmen or free, and have all been given to drink of one Spirit.
content_old: 13 For also in the power of one Spirit we have all been baptised into one body, whether Jews or Greeks, whether bondmen or free, and have all been given to drink of one Spirit.

content: 14 For also the body is not one member but many.
content_old: 14 For also the body is not one member but many.

content: 15 If the foot say, Because I am not a hand I am not of the body, is it on account of this not indeed of the body?
content_old: 15 If the foot say, Because I am not a hand I am not of the body, is it on account of this not indeed of the body?

content: 16 And if the ear say, Because I am not an eye I am not of the body, is it on account of this not indeed of the body?
content_old: 16 And if the ear say, Because I am not an eye I am not of the body, is it on account of this not indeed of the body?

content: 17 If the whole body were an eye, where the hearing? if all hearing, where the smelling?
content_old: 17 If the whole body were an eye, where the hearing? if all hearing, where the smelling?

content: 18 But now God has set the members, each one of them in the body, according as it has pleased him.
content_old: 18 But now God has set the members, each one of them in the body, according as it has pleased him.

content: 19 But if all were one member, where the body?
content_old: 19 But if all were one member, where the body?

content: 20 But now the members are many, and the body one.
content_old: 20 But now the members are many, and the body one.

content: 21 The eye cannot say to the hand, I have not need of thee; or again, the head to the feet, I have not need of you.
content_old: 21 The eye cannot say to the hand, I have not need of thee; or again, the head to the feet, I have not need of you.

content: 22 But much rather, the members of the body which seem to be weaker are necessary;
content_old: 22 But much rather, the members of the body which seem to be weaker are necessary;

content: 23 and those parts of the body which we esteem to be the more void of honour, these we clothe with more abundant honour; and our uncomely parts have more abundant comeliness;
content_old: 23 and those parts of the body which we esteem to be the more void of honour, these we clothe with more abundant honour; and our uncomely parts have more abundant comeliness;

content: 24 but our comely parts have not need. But God has tempered the body together, having given more abundant honour to the part that lacked;
content_old: 24 but our comely parts have not need. But God has tempered the body together, having given more abundant honour to the part that lacked;

content: 25 that there might be no division in the body, but that the members might have the same concern one for another.
content_old: 25 that there might be no division in the body, but that the members might have the same concern one for another.

content: 26 And if one member suffer, all the members suffer with it; and if one member be glorified, all the members rejoice with it.
content_old: 26 And if one member suffer, all the members suffer with it; and if one member be glorified, all the members rejoice with it.

content: 27 Now ye are Christ��s body, and members in particular.
content_old: 27 Now ye are Christ��s body, and members in particular.

content: 28 And God has set certain in the assembly: first, apostles; secondly, prophets; thirdly, teachers; then miraculous powers; then gifts of healings; helps; governments; kinds of tongues.
content_old: 28 And God has set certain in the assembly: first, apostles; secondly, prophets; thirdly, teachers; then miraculous powers; then gifts of healings; helps; governments; kinds of tongues.

content: 29 Are all apostles? are all prophets? are all teachers? are all in possession of miraculous powers?
content_old: 29 Are all apostles? are all prophets? are all teachers? are all in possession of miraculous powers?

content: 30 have all gifts of healings? do all speak with tongues? do all interpret?
content_old: 30 have all gifts of healings? do all speak with tongues? do all interpret?

content: 1 If I speak with the tongues of men and of angels, but have not love, I am become sounding brass or a clanging cymbal.
content_old: 1 If I speak with the tongues of men and of angels, but have not love, I am become sounding brass or a clanging cymbal.

content: 2 And if I have prophecy, and know all mysteries and all knowledge, and if I have all faith, so as to remove mountains, but have not love, I am nothing.
content_old: 2 And if I have prophecy, and know all mysteries and all knowledge, and if I have all faith, so as to remove mountains, but have not love, I am nothing.

content: 3 And if I shall dole out all my goods in food, and if I deliver up my body that I may be burned, but have not love, I profit nothing.
content_old: 3 And if I shall dole out all my goods in food, and if I deliver up my body that I may be burned, but have not love, I profit nothing.

content: 4 Love has long patience, is kind; love is not emulous of others; love is not insolent and rash, is not puffed up,
content_old: 4 Love has long patience, is kind; love is not emulous of others; love is not insolent and rash, is not puffed up,

content: 5 does not behave in an unseemly manner, does not seek what is its own, is not quickly provoked, does not impute evil,
content_old: 5 does not behave in an unseemly manner, does not seek what is its own, is not quickly provoked, does not impute evil,

content: 6 does not rejoice at iniquity but rejoices with the truth,
content_old: 6 does not rejoice at iniquity but rejoices with the truth,

content: 7 bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things.
content_old: 7 bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things.

content: 8 Love never fails; but whether prophecies, they shall be done away; or tongues, they shall cease; or knowledge, it shall be done away.
content_old: 8 Love never fails; but whether prophecies, they shall be done away; or tongues, they shall cease; or knowledge, it shall be done away.

content: 9 For we know in part, and we prophesy in part:
content_old: 9 For we know in part, and we prophesy in part:

content: 10 but when that which is perfect has come, that which is in part shall be done away.
content_old: 10 but when that which is perfect has come, that which is in part shall be done away.

content: 11 When I was a child, I spoke as a child, I felt as a child, I reasoned as a child; when I became a man, I had done with what belonged to the child.
content_old: 11 When I was a child, I spoke as a child, I felt as a child, I reasoned as a child; when I became a man, I had done with what belonged to the child.

content: 12 For we see now through a dim window obscurely, but then face to face; now I know partially, but then I shall know according as I also have been known.
content_old: 12 For we see now through a dim window obscurely, but then face to face; now I know partially, but then I shall know according as I also have been known.

content: 1 Follow after love, and be emulous of spiritual manifestations, but rather that ye may prophesy.
content_old: 1 Follow after love, and be emulous of spiritual manifestations, but rather that ye may prophesy.

content: 2 For he that speaks with a tongue does not speak to men but to God: for no one hears; but in spirit he speaks mysteries.
content_old: 2 For he that speaks with a tongue does not speak to men but to God: for no one hears; but in spirit he speaks mysteries.

content: 3 But he that prophesies speaks to men in edification, and encouragement, and consolation.
content_old: 3 But he that prophesies speaks to men in edification, and encouragement, and consolation.

content: 4 He that speaks with a tongue edifies himself; but he that prophesies edifies the assembly.
content_old: 4 He that speaks with a tongue edifies himself; but he that prophesies edifies the assembly.

content: 5 Now I desire that ye should all speak with tongues, but rather that ye should prophesy. But greater is he that prophesies than he that speaks with tongues, unless he interpret, that the assembly may receive edification.
content_old: 5 Now I desire that ye should all speak with tongues, but rather that ye should prophesy. But greater is he that prophesies than he that speaks with tongues, unless he interpret, that the assembly may receive edification.

content: 6 And now, brethren, if I come to you speaking with tongues, what shall I profit you, unless I shall speak to you either in revelation, or in knowledge, or in prophecy, or in teaching?
content_old: 6 And now, brethren, if I come to you speaking with tongues, what shall I profit you, unless I shall speak to you either in revelation, or in knowledge, or in prophecy, or in teaching?

content: 7 Even lifeless things giving a sound, whether pipe or harp, if they give not distinction to the sounds, how shall it be known what is piped or harped?
content_old: 7 Even lifeless things giving a sound, whether pipe or harp, if they give not distinction to the sounds, how shall it be known what is piped or harped?

content: 8 For also, if the trumpet give an uncertain sound, who shall prepare himself for war?
content_old: 8 For also, if the trumpet give an uncertain sound, who shall prepare himself for war?

content: 9 Thus also ye with the tongue, unless ye give a distinct speech, how shall it be known what is spoken? for ye will be speaking to the air.
content_old: 9 Thus also ye with the tongue, unless ye give a distinct speech, how shall it be known what is spoken? for ye will be speaking to the air.

content: 10 There are, it may be, so many kinds of voices in the world, and none of undistinguishable sound.
content_old: 10 There are, it may be, so many kinds of voices in the world, and none of undistinguishable sound.

content: 11 If therefore I do not know the power of the sound, I shall be to him that speaks a barbarian, and he that speaks a barbarian for me.
content_old: 11 If therefore I do not know the power of the sound, I shall be to him that speaks a barbarian, and he that speaks a barbarian for me.
