content: 12 Thus ye also, since ye are desirous of spirits, seek that ye may abound for the edification of the assembly.
content_old: 12 Thus ye also, since ye are desirous of spirits, seek that ye may abound for the edification of the assembly.

content: 13 Wherefore let him that speaks with a tongue pray that he may interpret.
content_old: 13 Wherefore let him that speaks with a tongue pray that he may interpret.

content: 14 For if I pray with a tongue, my spirit prays, but my understanding is unfruitful.
content_old: 14 For if I pray with a tongue, my spirit prays, but my understanding is unfruitful.

content: 15 What is it then? I will pray with the spirit, but I will pray also with the understanding; I will sing with the spirit, but I will sing also with the understanding.
content_old: 15 What is it then? I will pray with the spirit, but I will pray also with the understanding; I will sing with the spirit, but I will sing also with the understanding.

content: 16 Since otherwise, if thou blessest with the spirit, how shall he who fills the place of the simple Christian say Amen, at thy giving of thanks, since he does not know what thou sayest?
content_old: 16 Since otherwise, if thou blessest with the spirit, how shall he who fills the place of the simple Christian say Amen, at thy giving of thanks, since he does not know what thou sayest?

content: 17 For thou indeed givest thanks well, but the other is not edified.
content_old: 17 For thou indeed givest thanks well, but the other is not edified.

content: 18 I thank God I speak in a tongue more than all of you:
content_old: 18 I thank God I speak in a tongue more than all of you:

content: 19 but in the assembly I desire to speak five words with my understanding, that I may instruct others also, rather than ten thousand words in a tongue.
content_old: 19 but in the assembly I desire to speak five words with my understanding, that I may instruct others also, rather than ten thousand words in a tongue.

content: 20 Brethren, be not children in your minds, but in malice be babes; but in your minds be grown men.
content_old: 20 Brethren, be not children in your minds, but in malice be babes; but in your minds be grown men.

content: 21 It is written in the law, By people of other tongues, and by strange lips, will I speak to this people; and neither thus will they hear me, saith the Lord.
content_old: 21 It is written in the law, By people of other tongues, and by strange lips, will I speak to this people; and neither thus will they hear me, saith the Lord.

content: 22 So that tongues are for a sign, not to those who believe, but to unbelievers; but prophecy, not to unbelievers, but to those who believe.
content_old: 22 So that tongues are for a sign, not to those who believe, but to unbelievers; but prophecy, not to unbelievers, but to those who believe.

content: 23 If therefore the whole assembly come together in one place, and all speak with tongues, and simple persons enter in, or unbelievers, will not they say ye are mad?
content_old: 23 If therefore the whole assembly come together in one place, and all speak with tongues, and simple persons enter in, or unbelievers, will not they say ye are mad?

content: 24 But if all prophesy, and some unbeliever or simple person come in, he is convicted of all, he is judged of all;
content_old: 24 But if all prophesy, and some unbeliever or simple person come in, he is convicted of all, he is judged of all;

content: 25 the secrets of his heart are manifested; and thus, falling upon his face, he will do homage to God, reporting that God is indeed amongst you.
content_old: 25 the secrets of his heart are manifested; and thus, falling upon his face, he will do homage to God, reporting that God is indeed amongst you.

content: 26 What is it then, brethren? whenever ye come together, each of you has a psalm, has a teaching, has a tongue, has a revelation, has an interpretation. Let all things be done to edification.
content_old: 26 What is it then, brethren? whenever ye come together, each of you has a psalm, has a teaching, has a tongue, has a revelation, has an interpretation. Let all things be done to edification.

content: 27 If any one speak with a tongue, let it be two, or at the most three, and separately, and let one interpret;
content_old: 27 If any one speak with a tongue, let it be two, or at the most three, and separately, and let one interpret;

content: 28 but if there be no interpreter, let him be silent in the assembly, and let him speak to himself and to God.
content_old: 28 but if there be no interpreter, let him be silent in the assembly, and let him speak to himself and to God.

content: 29 And let two or three prophets speak, and let the others judge.
content_old: 29 And let two or three prophets speak, and let the others judge.

content: 30 But if there be a revelation to another sitting there, let the first be silent.
content_old: 30 But if there be a revelation to another sitting there, let the first be silent.

content: 31 For ye can all prophesy one by one, that all may learn and all be encouraged.
content_old: 31 For ye can all prophesy one by one, that all may learn and all be encouraged.

content: 32 And spirits of prophets are subject to prophets.
content_old: 32 And spirits of prophets are subject to prophets.

content: 33 For God is not a God of disorder but of peace, as in all the assemblies of the saints.
content_old: 33 For God is not a God of disorder but of peace, as in all the assemblies of the saints.

content: 34 Let your women be silent in the assemblies, for it is not permitted to them to speak; but to be in subjection, as the law also says.
content_old: 34 Let your women be silent in the assemblies, for it is not permitted to them to speak; but to be in subjection, as the law also says.

content: 35 But if they wish to learn anything, let them ask their own husbands at home; for it is a shame for a woman to speak in assembly.
content_old: 35 But if they wish to learn anything, let them ask their own husbands at home; for it is a shame for a woman to speak in assembly.

content: 36 Did the word of God go out from you, or did it come to you only?
content_old: 36 Did the word of God go out from you, or did it come to you only?

content: 37 If any one thinks himself to be a prophet or spiritual, let him recognise the things that I write to you, that it is the Lord’s commandment.
content_old: 37 If any one thinks himself to be a prophet or spiritual, let him recognise the things that I write to you, that it is the Lord’s commandment.

content: 38 But if any be ignorant, let him be ignorant.
content_old: 38 But if any be ignorant, let him be ignorant.

content: 39 So that, brethren, desire to prophesy, and do not forbid the speaking with tongues.
content_old: 39 So that, brethren, desire to prophesy, and do not forbid the speaking with tongues.

content: 1 But I make known to you, brethren, the glad tidings which I announced to you, which also ye received, in which also ye stand,
content_old: 1 But I make known to you, brethren, the glad tidings which I announced to you, which also ye received, in which also ye stand,

content: 2 by which also ye are saved, (if ye hold fast the word which I announced to you as the glad tidings,) unless indeed ye have believed in vain.
content_old: 2 by which also ye are saved, (if ye hold fast the word which I announced to you as the glad tidings,) unless indeed ye have believed in vain.

content: 3 For I delivered to you, in the first place, what also I had received, that Christ died for our sins, according to the scriptures;
content_old: 3 For I delivered to you, in the first place, what also I had received, that Christ died for our sins, according to the scriptures;

content: 4 and that he was buried; and that he was raised the third day, according to the scriptures;
content_old: 4 and that he was buried; and that he was raised the third day, according to the scriptures;

content: 5 and that he appeared to Cephas, then to the twelve.
content_old: 5 and that he appeared to Cephas, then to the twelve.

content: 6 Then he appeared to above five hundred brethren at once, of whom the most remain until now, but some also have fallen asleep.
content_old: 6 Then he appeared to above five hundred brethren at once, of whom the most remain until now, but some also have fallen asleep.

content: 7 Then he appeared to James; then to all the apostles;
content_old: 7 Then he appeared to James; then to all the apostles;

content: 8 and last of all, as to an abortion, he appeared to me also.
content_old: 8 and last of all, as to an abortion, he appeared to me also.

content: 9 For I am the least of the apostles, who am not fit to be called apostle, because I have persecuted the assembly of God.
content_old: 9 For I am the least of the apostles, who am not fit to be called apostle, because I have persecuted the assembly of God.

content: 10 But by God’s grace I am what I am; and his grace, which was towards me, has not been vain; but I have laboured more abundantly than they all, but not I, but the grace of God which was with me.
content_old: 10 But by God’s grace I am what I am; and his grace, which was towards me, has not been vain; but I have laboured more abundantly than they all, but not I, but the grace of God which was with me.

content: 11 Whether, therefore, I or they, thus we preach, and thus ye have believed.
content_old: 11 Whether, therefore, I or they, thus we preach, and thus ye have believed.

content: 12 Now if Christ is preached that he is raised from among the dead, how say some among you that there is not a resurrection of those that are dead?
content_old: 12 Now if Christ is preached that he is raised from among the dead, how say some among you that there is not a resurrection of those that are dead?

content: 13 But if there is not a resurrection of those that are dead, neither is Christ raised:
content_old: 13 But if there is not a resurrection of those that are dead, neither is Christ raised:

content: 14 but if Christ is not raised, then, indeed, vain also is our preaching, and vain also your faith.
content_old: 14 but if Christ is not raised, then, indeed, vain also is our preaching, and vain also your faith.

content: 15 And we are found also false witnesses of God; for we have witnessed concerning God that he raised the Christ, whom he has not raised if indeed those that are dead are not raised.
content_old: 15 And we are found also false witnesses of God; for we have witnessed concerning God that he raised the Christ, whom he has not raised if indeed those that are dead are not raised.

content: 16 For if those that are dead are not raised, neither is Christ raised;
content_old: 16 For if those that are dead are not raised, neither is Christ raised;

content: 17 but if Christ be not raised, your faith is vain; ye are yet in your sins.
content_old: 17 but if Christ be not raised, your faith is vain; ye are yet in your sins.

content: 18 Then indeed also those who have fallen asleep in Christ have perished.
content_old: 18 Then indeed also those who have fallen asleep in Christ have perished.

content: 19 If in this life only we have hope in Christ, we are the most miserable of all men.
content_old: 19 If in this life only we have hope in Christ, we are the most miserable of all men.

content: 20 (But now Christ is raised from among the dead, first-fruits of those fallen asleep.
content_old: 20 (But now Christ is raised from among the dead, first-fruits of those fallen asleep.

content: 21 For since by man came death, by man also resurrection of those that are dead.
content_old: 21 For since by man came death, by man also resurrection of those that are dead.

content: 22 For as in the Adam all die, thus also in the Christ all shall be made alive.
content_old: 22 For as in the Adam all die, thus also in the Christ all shall be made alive.

content: 23 But each in his own rank: the first-fruits, Christ; then those that are the Christ’s at his coming.
content_old: 23 But each in his own rank: the first-fruits, Christ; then those that are the Christ’s at his coming.

content: 24 Then the end, when he gives up the kingdom to him who is God and Father; when he shall have annulled all rule and all authority and power.
content_old: 24 Then the end, when he gives up the kingdom to him who is God and Father; when he shall have annulled all rule and all authority and power.

content: 25 For he must reign until he put all enemies under his feet.
content_old: 25 For he must reign until he put all enemies under his feet.

content: 26 The last enemy that is annulled is death.
content_old: 26 The last enemy that is annulled is death.

content: 27 For he has put all things in subjection under his feet. But when he says that all things are put in subjection, it is evident that it is except him who put all things in subjection to him.
content_old: 27 For he has put all things in subjection under his feet. But when he says that all things are put in subjection, it is evident that it is except him who put all things in subjection to him.

content: 28 But when all things shall have been brought into subjection to him, then the Son also himself shall be placed in subjection to him who put all things in subjection to him, that God may be all in all.)
content_old: 28 But when all things shall have been brought into subjection to him, then the Son also himself shall be placed in subjection to him who put all things in subjection to him, that God may be all in all.)

content: 29 Since what shall the baptised for the dead do if those that are dead rise not at all? why also are they baptised for them?
content_old: 29 Since what shall the baptised for the dead do if those that are dead rise not at all? why also are they baptised for them?

content: 30 Why do we also endanger ourselves every hour?
content_old: 30 Why do we also endanger ourselves every hour?

content: 31 Daily I die, by your boasting which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord.
content_old: 31 Daily I die, by your boasting which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord.

content: 32 If, to speak after the manner of man, I have fought with beasts in Ephesus, what is the profit to me if those that are dead do not rise? let us eat and drink; for to-morrow we die.
content_old: 32 If, to speak after the manner of man, I have fought with beasts in Ephesus, what is the profit to me if those that are dead do not rise? let us eat and drink; for to-morrow we die.

content: 33 Be not deceived: evil communications corrupt good manners.
content_old: 33 Be not deceived: evil communications corrupt good manners.

content: 34 Awake up righteously, and sin not; for some are ignorant of God: I speak to you as a matter of shame.
content_old: 34 Awake up righteously, and sin not; for some are ignorant of God: I speak to you as a matter of shame.

content: 35 But some one will say, How are the dead raised? and with what body do they come?
content_old: 35 But some one will say, How are the dead raised? and with what body do they come?

content: 36 Fool; what thou sowest is not quickened unless it die.
content_old: 36 Fool; what thou sowest is not quickened unless it die.

content: 37 And what thou sowest, thou sowest not the body that shall be, but a bare grain: it may be of wheat, or some one of the rest:
content_old: 37 And what thou sowest, thou sowest not the body that shall be, but a bare grain: it may be of wheat, or some one of the rest:

content: 38 and God gives to it a body as he has pleased, and to each of the seeds its own body.
content_old: 38 and God gives to it a body as he has pleased, and to each of the seeds its own body.

content: 39 Every flesh is not the same flesh, but one is of men, and another flesh of beasts, and another flesh of birds, and another of fishes.
content_old: 39 Every flesh is not the same flesh, but one is of men, and another flesh of beasts, and another flesh of birds, and another of fishes.

content: 40 And there are heavenly bodies, and earthly bodies: but different is the glory of the heavenly, different that of the earthly:
content_old: 40 And there are heavenly bodies, and earthly bodies: but different is the glory of the heavenly, different that of the earthly:

content: 41 one the sun’s glory, and another the moon’s glory, and another the stars’ glory; for star differs from star in glory.
content_old: 41 one the sun’s glory, and another the moon’s glory, and another the stars’ glory; for star differs from star in glory.

content: 42 Thus also is the resurrection of the dead. It is sown in corruption, it is raised in incorruptibility.
content_old: 42 Thus also is the resurrection of the dead. It is sown in corruption, it is raised in incorruptibility.

content: 43 It is sown in dishonour, it is raised in glory. It is sown in weakness, it is raised in power.
content_old: 43 It is sown in dishonour, it is raised in glory. It is sown in weakness, it is raised in power.

content: 44 It is sown a natural body, it is raised a spiritual body: if there is a natural body, there is also a spiritual one.
content_old: 44 It is sown a natural body, it is raised a spiritual body: if there is a natural body, there is also a spiritual one.

content: 45 Thus also it is written, The first man Adam became a living soul; the last Adam a quickening spirit.
content_old: 45 Thus also it is written, The first man Adam became a living soul; the last Adam a quickening spirit.

content: 46 But that which is spiritual was not first, but that which is natural, then that which is spiritual:
content_old: 46 But that which is spiritual was not first, but that which is natural, then that which is spiritual:

content: 47 the first man out of the earth, made of dust; the second man, out of heaven.
content_old: 47 the first man out of the earth, made of dust; the second man, out of heaven.

content: 48 Such as he made of dust, such also those made of dust; and such as the heavenly one, such also the heavenly ones.
content_old: 48 Such as he made of dust, such also those made of dust; and such as the heavenly one, such also the heavenly ones.

content: 49 And as we have borne the image of the one made of dust, we shall bear also the image of the heavenly one.
content_old: 49 And as we have borne the image of the one made of dust, we shall bear also the image of the heavenly one.

content: 50 But this I say, brethren, that flesh and blood cannot inherit God’s kingdom, nor does corruption inherit incorruptibility.
content_old: 50 But this I say, brethren, that flesh and blood cannot inherit God’s kingdom, nor does corruption inherit incorruptibility.

content: 51 Behold, I tell you a mystery: We shall not all fall asleep, but we shall all be changed,
content_old: 51 Behold, I tell you a mystery: We shall not all fall asleep, but we shall all be changed,

content: 52 in an instant, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trumpet; for the trumpet shall sound, and the dead shall be raised incorruptible, and we shall be changed.
content_old: 52 in an instant, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trumpet; for the trumpet shall sound, and the dead shall be raised incorruptible, and we shall be changed.

content: 53 For this corruptible must needs put on incorruptibility, and this mortal put on immortality.
content_old: 53 For this corruptible must needs put on incorruptibility, and this mortal put on immortality.

content: 54 But when this corruptible shall have put on incorruptibility, and this mortal shall have put on immortality, then shall come to pass the word written: Death has been swallowed up in victory.
content_old: 54 But when this corruptible shall have put on incorruptibility, and this mortal shall have put on immortality, then shall come to pass the word written: Death has been swallowed up in victory.

content: 55 Where, O death, is thy sting? where, O death, thy victory?
content_old: 55 Where, O death, is thy sting? where, O death, thy victory?

content: 56 Now the sting of death is sin, and the power of sin the law;
content_old: 56 Now the sting of death is sin, and the power of sin the law;

content: 57 but thanks to God, who gives us the victory by our Lord Jesus Christ.
content_old: 57 but thanks to God, who gives us the victory by our Lord Jesus Christ.

content: 1 Now concerning the collection for the saints, as I directed the assemblies of Galatia, so do ye do also.
content_old: 1 Now concerning the collection for the saints, as I directed the assemblies of Galatia, so do ye do also.

content: 2 On the first of the week let each of you put by at home, laying up in whatever degree he may have prospered, that there may be no collections when I come.
content_old: 2 On the first of the week let each of you put by at home, laying up in whatever degree he may have prospered, that there may be no collections when I come.

content: 3 And when I am arrived, whomsoever ye shall approve, these I will send with letters to carry your bounty to Jerusalem:
content_old: 3 And when I am arrived, whomsoever ye shall approve, these I will send with letters to carry your bounty to Jerusalem:

content: 4 and if it be suitable that I also should go, they shall go with me.
content_old: 4 and if it be suitable that I also should go, they shall go with me.

content: 5 But I will come to you when I shall have gone through Macedonia; for I do go through Macedonia.
content_old: 5 But I will come to you when I shall have gone through Macedonia; for I do go through Macedonia.

content: 6 But perhaps I will stay with you, or even winter with you, that ye may set me forward wheresoever I may go.
content_old: 6 But perhaps I will stay with you, or even winter with you, that ye may set me forward wheresoever I may go.

content: 7 For I will not see you now in passing, for I hope to remain a certain time with you, if the Lord permit.
content_old: 7 For I will not see you now in passing, for I hope to remain a certain time with you, if the Lord permit.

content: 8 But I remain in Ephesus until Pentecost.
content_old: 8 But I remain in Ephesus until Pentecost.

content: 9 For a great door is opened to me and an effectual one, and the adversaries many.
content_old: 9 For a great door is opened to me and an effectual one, and the adversaries many.

content: 10 Now if Timotheus come, see that he may be with you without fear; for he works the work of the Lord, even as I.
content_old: 10 Now if Timotheus come, see that he may be with you without fear; for he works the work of the Lord, even as I.

content: 11 Let not therefore any one despise him; but set him forward in peace, that he may come to me; for I expect him with the brethren.
content_old: 11 Let not therefore any one despise him; but set him forward in peace, that he may come to me; for I expect him with the brethren.

content: 12 Now concerning the brother Apollos, I begged him much that he would go to you with the brethren; but it was not at all his will to go now; but he will come when he shall have good opportunity.
content_old: 12 Now concerning the brother Apollos, I begged him much that he would go to you with the brethren; but it was not at all his will to go now; but he will come when he shall have good opportunity.

content: 13 Be vigilant; stand fast in the faith; quit yourselves like men; be strong.
content_old: 13 Be vigilant; stand fast in the faith; quit yourselves like men; be strong.

content: 14 Let all things ye do be done in love.
content_old: 14 Let all things ye do be done in love.

content: 15 But I beseech you, brethren, (ye know the house of Stephanas, that it is the first-fruits of Achaia, and they have devoted themselves to the saints for service,)
content_old: 15 But I beseech you, brethren, (ye know the house of Stephanas, that it is the first-fruits of Achaia, and they have devoted themselves to the saints for service,)

content: 16 that ye should also be subject to such, and to every one joined in the work and labouring.
content_old: 16 that ye should also be subject to such, and to every one joined in the work and labouring.

content: 17 But I rejoice in the coming of Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus; because they have supplied what was lacking on your part.
content_old: 17 But I rejoice in the coming of Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus; because they have supplied what was lacking on your part.

content: 18 For they have refreshed my spirit and yours: own therefore such.
content_old: 18 For they have refreshed my spirit and yours: own therefore such.

content: 19 The assemblies of Asia salute you. Aquila and Priscilla, with the assembly in their house, salute you much in the Lord.
content_old: 19 The assemblies of Asia salute you. Aquila and Priscilla, with the assembly in their house, salute you much in the Lord.

content: 20 All the brethren salute you. Salute one another with a holy kiss.
content_old: 20 All the brethren salute you. Salute one another with a holy kiss.

content: 21 The salutation of me Paul with my own hand.
content_old: 21 The salutation of me Paul with my own hand.

content: 22 If any one love not the Lord Jesus Christ let him be Anathema Maranatha.
content_old: 22 If any one love not the Lord Jesus Christ let him be Anathema Maranatha.

content: 23 The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
content_old: 23 The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
